wikipedia_page.main: Kimberley "Kim" Jerray-Silver (born 10 June 1977) is a former English international footballer. She was a full–time professional player with Fulham, whom she joined from Arsenal.

response: Jones was angry when his players subsequently began to join rival clubs, attributing their departure to "a little bit of, shall we say, greed." Since the win over Doncaster Belles, three players had moved to Arsenal (Smith, Kim Jerray-Silver and goalkeeper Sarah Reed) and another three to final opponents Millwall Lionesses (Sally Ede, Pam Bedzrah and Justine Lorton).
